unnormalised: **Social Media & Influencer Marketing: Are You REALLY Seeing Your Followers?**
normalised: **Social Media and Influencer Marketing: Are You Really Seeing Your Followers?**

unnormalised: Okay, Insta-fam, let's talk analytics. Are you *actually* checking where your followers are coming from, or just posting those Diwali selfies and hoping for the best?
normalised: Okay, Insta-fam, let's talk analytics. Are you actually checking where your followers are coming from, or just posting those Diwali selfies and hoping for the best?

unnormalised: Turns out, diving deep into follower analytics can seriously boost your influencer game. We're not just talking likes, folks! Knowing if your audience is mostly in Mumbai vs. Madras, or if they're more interested in sarees than sneakers, is HUGE.
normalised: Turns out, diving deep into follower analytics can seriously boost your influencer game. We are not just talking likes, folks! Knowing if your audience is mostly in Mumbai versus Madras, or if they are more interested in sarees than sneakers, is huge.

unnormalised: Think about it: If you’re selling organic jaggery from Kerala and most of your followers are ordering pizza at 2 AM, you’ve got a problem.
normalised: Think about it: If you are selling organic jaggery from Kerala and most of your followers are ordering pizza at two A M, you have got a problem.

unnormalised: Platforms like Instagram and even homegrown ShareChat are upping their analytics game, giving you way more data. This includes metrics like peak engagement times (think 17:00 hrs-19:00 hrs - chai time!), demographic insights and even competitor analysis.
normalised: Platforms like Instagram and even homegrown ShareChat are upping their analytics game, giving you way more data. This includes metrics like peak engagement times (think seventeen hundred hours to nineteen hundred hours - chai time!), demographic insights and even competitor analysis.

unnormalised: Don't be a Chintu, analyze your data! It's about understanding who *really* sees your content, allowing you to craft campaigns that resonate. Remember that 26/01/1950 feeling? Recreate it!
normalised: Don't be a Chintu, analyze your data! It is about understanding who really sees your content, allowing you to craft campaigns that resonate. Remember that twenty sixth january nineteen fifty feeling? Recreate it!

unnormalised: Heads up to those partnering with brands - analytics make you way more valuable. Companies now demand insights before spending those big Rs. Take it seriously, or you will be stuck getting views from that distant aunty on 10/05/2024, wishing you were a doctor!
normalised: Heads up to those partnering with brands - analytics make you way more valuable. Companies now demand insights before spending those big rupees. Take it seriously, or you will be stuck getting views from that distant aunty on tenth may two thousand and twenty four, wishing you were a doctor!
